identificationModule.briefTitle: HSAT for OSA Management in Children
identificationModule.officialTitle: Home Sleep Apnea Testing for the Evaluation of Obstructive Sleep Apnea in Children Following Management With Adenotonsillectomy

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This clinical trial will compare the diagnostic accuracy of type II HSAT with PSG for determining OSA status following treatment with adenotonsillectomy in children
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Many children have residual obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) following adenotonsillectomy, but in-lab polysomnography (PSG), the recommended means of re-evaluating these patients, is resource-intensive and availability is limited. Home sleep apnea testing (HSAT), a similar test performed in the patient's home and used clinically in adults, may offer an alternative means of evaluating the effect of OSA treatment in children and make testing more convenient and widely available.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Participants will be randomized to the initial test (home sleep apnea test or polysomnography) and then complete the alternate test within approximately one week.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: The investigators will be masked as to the order of the two sleep tests

armGroups.label: HSAT prior to clinical sleep study
armGroups.description: Participants will be randomized to undergo HSAT before receiving their clinical, in-lab polysomnography
interventionNames: Diagnostic Test: Home sleep apnea test

armGroups.label: PSG first Participants will be random
armGroups.description: Participants will be randomized to undergo HSAT after receiving their clinical, in-lab polysomnography.

interventions.name: Home sleep apnea test
interventions.description: Level II home sleep apnea testing evaluates for obstructive sleep apnea in the home environment with parental supervision.
armGroupLabels: HSAT prior to clinical sleep study

interventions.name: PSG
interventions.description: Overnight sleep study in the sleep laboratory with continuous monitoring by clinical staff.
armGroupLabels: PSG first Participants will be random

primaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation between obstructive apnea hypopnea index (OAHI) by HSAT vs PSG
primaryOutcomes.description: Correlation will be assessed in all participants completing PSG and HSAT using the OAHI from both tests

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation between OAHI from HSAT and score from OSA questionnaires
secondaryOutcomes.description: Correlation between OAHI from HSAT will be measured by completion of the Pediatric Sleep Questionnaire-Sleep Related Breathing Disorders scale (PSQ-SRBD) and OSA-18 Questionnaire. . The PSQ-SRBD is a 22-item questionnaire where a score of \>0.33 is consistent with a diagnosis of OSA. The OSA-18 consists of 18 questions for which the overall total scores will assess for OSA risk. Total scores range from 18 to 126, with 18 indicating low risk of OSA and 126 indicating high risk of OSA.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Parent-reported preference between HSAT and PSG
secondaryOutcomes.description: Parent-reported preference between HSAT and PSG will be measured by the parents' completion of the preference questionnaire after completion of both studies. The questionnaire contains 5 questions for which the overall score will assess for preference. Total scores range from 5 to 10, with 5 indicating a strong preference for HSAT and 10 indicating a low preference for HSAT.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Child-reported preference between HSAT and PSG
secondaryOutcomes.description: Child-reported preference between HSAT and PSG will be measured by the child's completion of the preference questionnaire after completion of both studies. The questionnaire contains 5 questions for which the overall score will assess for preference. Total scores range from 5 to 10, with 5 indicating a strong preference for HSAT and 10 indicating a low preference for HSAT.

Parent-reported acceptability of HSAT will be measures by the parents' completion of the acceptability questionnaire after completion of both studies. The questionnaire contains 4 questions for which the overall score will assess for preference. Total scores range from 4 to 20, with 4 indicating a strong preference for HSAT and 20 indicating a low preference for HSAT.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Male and female children age 5-12 years old inclusive
* History of adenotonsillectomy for OSA

Exclusion Criteria:

* Children with a history of hypoventilation or hypoxemia or who require supplemental oxygen or positive airway pressure during sleep
* Children with a tracheostomy or tracheocutaneous fistula
* Children who live in a facility without their parent
